x-fapi-auth-date.description:
The time when the PSU last logged in with the TPP. 
All dates in the HTTP headers are represented as RFC 7231 Full Dates. An example is below: 
Sun, 10 Sep 2017 19:43:31 UTC

x-fapi-customer-ip-address.description: The PSU's IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

x-fapi-interaction-id.description: An RFC4122 UID used as a correlation id.

Authorization.description: An Authorisation Token as per https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750

x-customer-user-agent.description: Indicates the user-agent that the PSU is using.

$ul: **Data**
**ConsentId**: Unique identification as assigned by the ASPSP to uniquely identify the funds confirmation consent resource.
**CreationDateTime**: Date and time at which the resource was created.All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
**FundsAvailable**: Flag to indicate the result of a confirmation of funds check.
**FundsConfirmationId**: Unique identification as assigned by the ASPSP to uniquely identify the funds confirmation resource.
**InstructedAmount**: Amount of money to be confirmed as available funds in the debtor account. Contains an Amount and a Currency.
**Amount**: A number of monetary units specified in an active currency where the unit of currency is explicit and compliant with ISO 4217.

**Currency**: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 "Codes for the representation of currencies and funds".
**Reference**: Unique reference, as assigned by the CBPII, to unambiguously refer to the request related to the payment transaction.
**Links**: Links relevant to the payload

**Meta**: Meta Data relevant to the payload
**FirstAvailableDateTime**: All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
**LastAvailableDateTime**: All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
